title: Bob Barker treated for cut, scrape after a sidewalk fall
text:
Bob Barker treated for cut, scrape after a sidewalk fall Bob Barker is resting at home after taking a fall on a Los Angeles street. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Bob Barker treated for cut, scrape after a sidewalk fall Associated Press, AP 11:57 a.m. EDT October 25, 2015 Bob Barker CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Bob Barker is resting at home after taking a fall on a Los Angeles street. 
Barker's longtime friend and publicist, Henri Bollinger, said the former "The Price is Right" host suffered a cut to his head that required stitches, and a scraped leg. 
Barker, 91, was out for his daily walk earlier this week near his house when he stumbled on uneven pavement, Bollinger said. 
Two police officers who were nearby came to his aid, summoning an ambulance. Barker was taken to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center for treatment and released. 
He walked out of the hospital, said Bollinger, who drove him home. 
Barker was the longtime host of "The Price is Right," retiring from the game show in 2007 after 35 years. Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1N0V5IU TOP VIDEOS
